mobs.long_desc: A new recruit is here starting his task.
mobs.desc: This new recruit looks young by dwarven standards, as his beard has barely grown out long enough to braid.  He handles his tools with less confidence than an experienced miner would, but his muscled frame looks quite fierce nonetheless.  Still, he looks unsure of what exactly his job is.

mobs.long_desc: A blind reptilian sniffs around the tunnel.
mobs.desc: A little taller than a dwarf, this odd creature seems intelligent even though it completely lacks eyes.  Its hands have three long, suctioned fingers that it uses to move around all surfaces of the cavern walls.  Its skin is pale, but shifts slightly whenever it moves to approximately match the shade of the stone walls.  From time to time, its tongue will flick out, tasting the heat in the air for signs of other life.

mobs.long_desc: A dwarven miner is here, guarding the way into the mine.
mobs.desc: Short and stocky like most dwarves, this one is on guard duty protecting the mine from intruders.  He looks capable of pulverizing rock with his bare hands, so messing with him might not be the best idea.  He stands tall and proud, always on the lookout for anyone who would threaten his mine.

mobs.keywords: badger beastly blind white-eyed beastly-blind-badger snarling
mobs.long_desc: A snarling, white-eyed badger is scuffling about here.
mobs.desc: Large for a burrowing animal, this badger seems to have found its way into the mine and made its home here.  Every so often it will lift its muzzle into the air and sniff, no doubt seeking the smell of prey.  Though its camouflaged fur does little to help it here in the dark, it probably keeps the beast quite warm in the cool temperatures underground.

mobs.long_desc: The dwawrven overseer is here, inspecting every part of the mining operation.
mobs.desc: Clearly the one in charge, this dwarf's appearance is impeccable.  There is always a scowl on his face, for he inspects every aspect of the mine and quickly angers if he finds something out of place.  It is surely a high-stress job, but he seems well-suited to it.

mobs.long_desc: A young miner is working here.
mobs.desc: A young miner is hauling away rubble and ore here.  If there is a cart nearby he will use that; otherwise, he uses only his hands and his strong dwarven arms.  His beard looks grey, but it is only an illusion from the dust of the mines.  Perhaps after many long years of hard work and observation, he will be allowed to sculpt the rock himself.

mobs.long_desc: A little dwarven girl is here, playing in the mine.
mobs.desc: Young and high-spirited, this girl is playing hide-and-seek with her shadow here in the mines.  Why she is allowed down here is not apparent, but the mine workers don't seem to mind her presence.  She is dressed in plain linen that is rather dirty from the dust and smoke of the mine.

mobs.long_desc: A old miner is here drinking out of his canteen.
mobs.desc: Though he looks quite aged, this miner's muscles are as hard as the stones he works with.  His clothes, hair, and beard are all covered in the dust of the mine, but he does not seem to notice.  He seems to be temporarily resting from his work and taking a much-needed water break.

mobs.long_desc: A small bat flutters around the mine, seeking insect prey.
mobs.desc: Sporting no eyes but very large ears, this bat is adapted to life underground in the absolute darkness.  Now and then it emits high-pitched squeaks, using the echoes of its own cries to locate walls, insects, and intruders like yourself.  It is covered in pale, wiry hair and looks a little bit like a mouse with wings.  If it weren't so strange-looking, it'd be kind of cute.

mobs.keywords: dwarf dwarven miner stout sturdy sturdy-dwarven-miner
mobs.long_desc: A stout dwarf is chipping away at the rocks here.
mobs.desc: Standing about four feet tall and heavily muscled from years of working with stone, the miner seems ideally suited to his work in the tunnels.  A fine dust covers him, but he barely seems to notice anything besides the rock in front of him, working carefully to coax the gems and metals from the stone.

mobs.long_desc: A dwarf is resting here, taking a well-deserved break.
mobs.desc: A heavily-muscled dwarf is resting on one of the benches here eating some tasty-smelling stew.  He seems to be in good spirits and is probably ready to go back to work soon, but for the moment his tools are down and his only concern seems to be what bite of food to eat next.

mobs.long_desc: A large, pale cricket with elongated antennae hops around here.
mobs.desc: Larger than most outdoor crickets, the cave cricket is one of the primary food sources for underground creatures.  It feeds on fungus and tiny water creatures, though the lack of abundant food means that this kind of insect lives a bit longer than its distant outdoor relatives.  Its antennae are extra long to make up for its lack of eyes, and it moves quite fast when it senses danger.

mobs.long_desc: A pale, ghostly spider scurries about here.
mobs.desc: Extremely long legs with little feelers at the end and a lack of eyes characterizes this odd little spider.  Its thick antennae are constantly testing the ground for signs of recent passage of cave crickets, a delicacy for the little arachnid.  Though it lacks web glands, it is a quick little creature and is ready at any time to pounce on its prey and devour it.

mobs.long_desc: A glowing bug with many legs shuffles around here, looking for food.
mobs.desc: What a strange little bug this is!  Barely longer than the index finger of a grown human, this many-legged millipede has large, pale eyes that set it apart from most of the other cave dwellers.  The reason for this is apparent: it produces its own light somehow, with glowing patches of pale, greenish light all along its ridges and two large patches on its head and tail.  Whether by magic or nature, the light gives it a distinct advantage, in that it can see its predators coming.

mobs.keywords: miner dwarf tired resting old tired-miner
mobs.long_desc: A tired old miner rests here, taking a break.
mobs.desc: This miner looks like he has been working with stone for many long years.  His hands are gnarled from so many calluses, but he holds his pick like a master. Though his clothing is old, it is well-patched and it looks like he takes care of it.

mobs.long_desc: A thirsty miner is here opening his canteen.
mobs.desc: This dwarf is middle-aged, with only a few streaks of grey in his lush, brown beard.  His arms are thick with muscle and his hands look strong enough to crush bare rock without the aid of his trusty miner's pick, but he appears to be on break at the moment.

mobs.long_desc: A dwarf sharpening his pickaxe is here.
mobs.desc: This middle-aged dwarf is still a hard worker.  He takes his time sharpening his pick, knowing that a job done right is the only way to do anything. Muscles ripple with every movement he makes, yet he seems almost gentle as he hones the blade of his tool into something to be proud of.

mobs.keywords: beam starlight shade woman starlight-beam beam-starlight beam-star-light
mobs.long_desc: The shade of a young woman is floating here.
mobs.desc: Flickering in and out of sight, this apparition of a young woman is exactly the color of starlight on a clear night with no moons.  She looks small, but not young.  Her hair glimmers oddly with the memory of light, and she appears to be ignoring you completely.

objects.ground: A polished miner's pick lies here, getting dirty.

extras.text: It is a worn but serviceable pickaxe with a leather-covered wooden handle. Blades polished to a brilliant gleam, it looks like it has been cared for lovingly by the dwarf who last owned it.  Near where the blade connects to the shaft there is a maker's mark etched into the metal.
The maker's mark is a mountain with a tiered city, showing that it's from Anduin.  Below it is a line of runes reading "Jasper Ironfeld 464".

objects.ground: An old chest gathers dust here.
objects.action_desc: This wooden chest is old.  A slight mold is growing on the wood and the iron parts are rusted, probably because it is so close to the water.  It looks like it is bolted into the stone with heavy iron bolts, but why would anyone go to such trouble?

extras.text: This wooden chest is old.  A slight mold is growing on the wood and the iron parts are rusted, probably because it is so close to the water.  It looks like it is bolted into the stone with heavy iron bolts, but why would anyone go to such trouble?

objects.ground: A rough crystal is here, catching the light.

extras.text: Perhaps the size of a dwarf's thumbnail, this rock glints with a hidden value. Under all that dirt, it appears to be a rough diamond!  What a fortuitous discovery!  This would probably sell for a lot of money if the right buyer could be found, but as it is now it needs a little polish and faceting before it could be quite as valuable.

objects.ground: A sharp pickaxe has been abandoned here.

extras.text: Heavy and sharp, it gleams with the polish of a well-loved weapon and would be quite deadly to bare stone, trees, and anything else the owner would see fit to use it on.  Near the haft, a few dwarven runes are inscribed, which read "Onyx Stonehelm".

objects.ground: A pair of mining goggles is sitting on the ground here.

extras.text: This is a pair of fine goggles, made of expertly tanned leather and lenses of thick glass.  Excellent for protecting the eyes from the loose dust and occasional hazards in a mine, they would probably also be useful outdoors in a sandstorm, though underwater use would probably ruin the leather and is not recommended.

objects.ground: A steel pickaxe is gleaming in the light.

extras.text: About two feet long from the tip of the hilt to the midpoint of the blade, the pickaxe has a sharp, pointy end and a broader, flatter end depending on whether it is currently being used to make sharp gouges in rock or to scrape away at it.  It looks quite sharp and could probably be used as a weapon in addition to a tool.

objects.ground: A cold pool of water blocks passage north.

extras.text: Black, cold, and very pure, it is impossible to tell the depth of this pool just by looking into it due to the absolute clarity of the water.  It has a slight current coming from a crack in the northern wall and leading down a small fissure at the other end of the pool.  The water itself is icy-cold and has probably never seen the sun.

objects.ground: A coil of frayed rope sits here.

extras.text: This short length of rope looks like it has seen better days.  Made of a thick hempen material, it has begun to fray rather badly at the ends and may not support much weight.  Still, it would probably be quite useful in tying something up.

objects.ground: Barely visible, a silvery circle rests on the ground.

extras.text: Translucent yet solid, the circlet is made of some unknown material, definitely magical in nature.  When it touches light, it shimmers oddly, almost sparkling. Cool to the touch, it hums faintly and radiates a sense of calm to anyone near it.

objects.ground: A stone basin molds itself naturally into the rock here.

extras.text: This stone basin is made of a polished black granite and looks functional rather than decorational, though like all stonework made by dwarves it has its own beauty, looking like it was coaxed from the stone itself rather than made somewhere else and placed here.  The water is clear and cold.  Down underneath the basin is a little stream formed by the runoff that the creatures of the cave use as a water source, coming up to it to drink.  It was certainly considerate of the dwarves to take the natural ecology of the mine into account when they placed the basin here.

objects.ground: A strange rock formation stands near the center of the cavern.

extras.text: The formation appears to be some kind of natural pedestal, formed from centuries of erosion.

objects.ground: A shining electrum key hovers in the air.

extras.text: This solid electrum key emits sparks of glittering light.  Slightly warm to the touch, touching the key fills you with a gentle strength of purpose and determined resolve.  It bears numerous markings of the heavens and celestial bodies, making its divine providence clear.

objects.ground: An old anvil rests against the wall, unused for many years.

extras.text: Though it was once likely used by the dwarves of the mine to forge amazing works of weaponry and art, this anvil has been abandoned here and has, over time, gathered a fine sheen of rock over it from the constant heat and melted rock of the lava flow nearby.

triggers.name: bloodline
triggers.commands: if %actor.vnum% == -1 say Hello %actor.name% say How are you today? wait 2 s say Good weather yes? say You know a Bum named doal i hear their is a price on his head mload obj 13301 give pick %actor.name% mforce %actor.name% wield pick endif

triggers.name: raph_greet_queststart
triggers.commands: smile %actor.name% emote tosses an empty canteen across the room. say Do you have anything for me, or have you already tried to help me once? wait 2s say If you have something for me, gimme.  If you have done this quest, go away. else say I have been looking for something to eat in this world but to no avail, can you help me? glare %actor.name% *this is a quest for group heal for cleric classes, major globe for mages *and either switch or picklock skill enhancements for other classes

triggers.name: raph_speak_yesno
triggers.commands: if %actor.vnum% == -1 if %speech% /= yes say So you want to help me do you? Well that is useful, maybe I will survive. quest start get_raph_food %actor.name% smile say Please go get me some grain, I am very hungry and may pass on at any time. endif if %speech% /= no say Fine, let me die get out! spit %actor.name% wait 1 s msend %actor% Raph taps his wrists together and you are covered in smoke! mechoaround %actor% Raph glares at %actor.name% and sends him elsewhere! mteleport %actor% 13301 endif endif

triggers.name: exit_from_raph
triggers.commands: * to make this generic use %self.name% instead of raph, room is toughter.. growl say You are too cruel! msend %actor% Raph taps his wrists together and you are covered in smoke! mechoaround %actor% Raph glares at %actor.name% and sends him elsewhere! mteleport %actor% 13301

triggers.name: raph_get_him_donuts
triggers.commands: if %actor.vnum%== -1 wait 3 if  %object.vnun% == 16211 if  %actor.quest_stage[get_raph_food]% == 2 emote frowns as his tummy growls like a roar of thunder. wait 3s shake %actor.name% say Thank you for the grain but alas I'm too weak to make it into anything, go and get me a dozen donuts? quest advance get_raph_food %actor.name% smile else switch %actor.quest_stage[get_raph_food]% case 1 say How ever did you manage to get the grain without actually picking it up yourself?! frown %actor.name% break default say What a lovely bit of food, thank you! thank %actor.name% wait 2 say Shame you were not performing a quest, you seem like you could have helped an old man. done endif endif endif

triggers.name: raph_get_donut_want_cheese
triggers.commands: if %actor.vnum%== -1 wait 3 if  %object.vnun% == 36303 if  %actor.quest_stage[get_raph_food]% == 4 emote whines as his tummy growls again. wait 3s shake %actor.name% say Thank you for the donuts but sadly I fear I am close too death to enjoy the sweets.  But perhaps if you would get me some cheese... that would really save me. quest advance get_raph_food %actor.name% smile else switch %actor.quest_stage[get_raph_food]% case 1 case 2 say Unusual that you can get an object I have not even asked for yet. wait 2 say You shouldn't know to have this yet, cheater. break case 3 say How ever did you manage to get the donuts without actually picking it up yourself?! frown %actor.name% break default say What a lovely bit of food, thank you! thank %actor.name% wait 2 say Shame you were not performing a quest, you seem like you could have helped an old man. done endif endif endif

triggers.name: raph_recei_cheese_want_mussel
triggers.commands: if %actor.vnum%== -1 wait 3 if  %object.vnun% == 16015 if  %actor.quest_stage[get_raph_food]% == 6 emote groans hungrily. wait 3s shake %actor.name% say Thank you for the cheese, but sadly I fear only eating a mussel would save me.  I know I am getting picky, but I hear they have some magical healing properties. say Go humor an old man and get a mussel for me, so I might see another day. wait 2s emote looks sickly. say I have not had one since I was last down on that sea near those islands. emote licks his lips hungrily. quest advance get_raph_food %actor.name% smile else switch %actor.quest_stage[get_raph_food]% case 1 case 2 case 3 case 4 say Unusual that you can get an object I have not even asked for yet. wait 2 say You shouldn't know to have this yet, cheater. break case 5 say How ever did you manage to get the cheese without actually picking it up yourself?! frown %actor.name% break default say What a lovely bit of food, thank you! thank %actor.name% wait 2 say Shame you were not performing a quest, you seem like you could have helped an old man. done endif endif endif

triggers.name: raph_recei_mussel
triggers.commands: if %actor.vnum%== -1 wait 3s if  %object.vnun% == 49024 if  %actor.quest_stage[get_raph_food]% == 8 emote smiles a bit as his tummy growls very much. wait 3 shake %actor.name% say I thank you for all of your effort, but I am afraid you are too late.  Death is coming for me. quest advance get_raph_food %actor.name% tell %actor.name% If you would like your prize, 'tell raph Please'. wait 2s else switch %actor.quest_stage[get_raph_food]% case 1 case 2 case 3 case 4 case 5 case 6 say Unusual that you can get an object I have not even asked for yet. wait 2 say You shouldn't know to have this yet, cheater. break case 7 say How ever did you manage to get the mussel without actually picking it up yourself?! frown %actor.name% break default say What a lovely bit of food, thank you! thank %actor.name% wait 2 say Shame you were not performing a quest, you seem like you could have helped an old man. done wait 2s endif endif endif

triggers.name: raph_get_grain
triggers.commands: if %actor.vnum% == -1 if %actor.quest_stage[get_raph_food]% == 1 if %already_retrieved_grain% == 1 oechoaround %actor% The grain flows through %actor.name%'s hand, making a pile appear on the floor. osend %actor% The grain pass between your fingers, scratching you on the way. odamage %actor% 53 return 0 else quest advance get_raph_food %actor.name% endif endif endif set already_retrieved_grain 1 global already_retrieved_grain

triggers.name: raph_get_donuts
triggers.commands: if %actor.vnum% == -1 if %actor.quest_stage[get_raph_food]% == 3 if %already_retrieved_donuts% == 1 oechoaround %actor% The donuts crumble in %actor.name%'s hands, turning to dust. osend %actor% The donuts crumble to dust in your hands, turning to dust. return 0 else quest advance get_raph_food %actor.name% endif endif endif set already_retrieved_donuts 1 global already_retrieved_donuts

triggers.name: raph_get_cheese
triggers.commands: if %actor.vnum% == -1 if %actor.quest_stage[get_raph_food]% == 5 if %already_retrieved_cheese% == 1 oechoaround %actor% The cheese turns to a mushy goo in %actor.name%'s hands. osend %actor% You squished the cheese into goo! return 0 else quest advance get_raph_food %actor.name% endif endif endif set already_retrieved_cheese 1 global already_retrieved_cheese

triggers.name: raph_get_mussel
triggers.commands: if %actor.vnum% == -1 if %actor.quest_stage[get_raph_food]% == 7 if %already_retrieved_mussel% == 1 oechoaround %actor% The mussel slips from %actor.name%'s fingers, splatting on the ground. osend %actor% The mussel slips from your hands, darn slimy things. return 0 else quest advance get_raph_food %actor.name% endif endif endif set already_retrieved_mussel 1 global already_retrieved_mussel

triggers.name: tell_raph_Please
triggers.commands: wait 2 if %actor.vnum% == -1 if %actor.quest_stageget_raph_food% == 9 quest complete get_raph_food %actor.name% if %actor.class% /= Cleric smile %actor.name% mskillset %actor.name% 'group heal' 1000 if %actor.level% < 57 tell %actor.name% You will not be able to use your new ability for several levels. endif msave %actor% tell %actor.name% There you go, enjoy your new powers. elseif %actor.class% /= Priest smile %actor.name% mskillset %actor.name% 'group heal' 1000 if %actor.level% < 57 tell %actor.name% You will not be able to use your new ability for several levels. endif msave %actor% tell %actor.name% There you go, enjoy your new powers. elseif %actor.class% /= Diabolist smile %actor.name% mskillset %actor.name% 'group heal' 1000 if %actor.level% < 57 tell %actor.name% You will not be able to use your new ability for several levels. endif msave %actor% tell %actor.name% There you go, enjoy your new powers. elseif %actor.class% /= Druid smile %actor.name% mskillset %actor.name% 'invigorate' 1000 if %actor.level% < 65 tell %actor.name% You will not be able to use your new ability for several levels. endif msave %actor% tell %actor.name% There you go, enjoy your new powers. elseif %actor.class% /= Sorcerer smile %actor.name% mskillset %actor.name% 'major globe' 1000 if %actor.level% < 57 tell %actor.name% You will not be able to use your new ability for several levels. endif msave %actor% tell %actor.name% There you go, enjoy your new powers. elseif %actor.class% /= Pyromancer smile %actor.name% mskillset %actor.name% 'major globe' 1000 if %actor.level% < 57 tell %actor.name% You will not be able to use your new ability for several levels. endif msave %actor% tell %actor.name% There you go, enjoy your new powers. elseif %actor.class% /= Cryomancer smile %actor.name% mskillset %actor.name% 'major globe' 1000 if %actor.level% < 57 tell %actor.name% You will not be able to use your new ability for several levels. endif msave %actor% tell %actor.name% There you go, enjoy your new powers. elseif %actor.class% /= Necromancer smile %actor.name% mskillset %actor.name% 'summon dracolich' 1000 if %actor.level% < 73 tell %actor.name% You will not be able to use your new ability for several levels. endif msave %actor% tell %actor.name% There you go, enjoy your new powers. elseif %actor.class% /= Warrior smile %actor.name% * eval total %actor.level% * 10 + 50 skillset %actor.name% 'switch' total msave %actor% tell %actor.name% There you go, enjoy your enhanced skills. elseif %actor.class% /= Thief smile %actor.name% * eval total %actor.level% * 10 + 50 skillset %actor.name% 'pick lock' total msave %actor% tell %actor.name% There you go, enjoy your enhanced skills. elseif %actor.class% /= Paladin smile %actor.name% * eval total %actor.level% * 10 + 50 skillset %actor.name% 'switch' total msave %actor% tell %actor.name% There you go, enjoy your enhanced skills. elseif %actor.class% /= Antipaladin smile %actor.name% * eval total %actor.level% * 10 + 50 skillset %actor.name% 'switch' total msave %actor% tell %actor.name% There you go, enjoy your enhanced skills. elseif %actor.class% /= Ranger smile %actor.name% * eval total %actor.level% * 10 + 50 skillset %actor.name% 'switch' total msave %actor% tell %actor.name% There you go, enjoy your enhanced skills. elseif %actor.class% /= Assassin smile %actor.name% * eval total %actor.level% * 10 + 50 skillset %actor.name% 'pick lock' total msave %actor% tell %actor.name% There you go, enjoy your enhanced skills. elseif %actor.class% /= Mercenary smile %actor.name% * eval total %actor.level% * 10 + 50 skillset %actor.name% 'switch' total msave %actor% tell %actor.name% There you go, enjoy your enhanced skills. elseif %actor.class% /= Monk smile %actor.name% * eval total %actor.level% * 10 + 50 skillset %actor.name% 'switch' total msave %actor% tell %actor.name% There you go, enjoy your enhanced skills. elseif %actor.class% /= Berserker smile %actor.name% * eval total %actor.level% * 10 + 50 skillset %actor.name% 'switch' total msave %actor% tell %actor.name% There you go, enjoy your enhanced skills. elseif %actor.class% /= Rogue smile %actor.name% * eval total %actor.level% * 10 + 50 skillset %actor.name% 'pick lock' total msave %actor% tell %actor.name% There you go, enjoy your enhanced skills. elseif %actor.class% /= Bard smile %actor.name% * eval total %actor.level% * 10 + 50 skillset %actor.name% 'pick lock' total msave %actor% tell %actor.name% There you go, enjoy your enhanced skills. endif else tell %actor.name% What do you want, go about your business. endif endif

triggers.name: dwarf-sharpening-pickaxe
triggers.commands: mecho &3&bSparks&0 fly as a dwarf runs a sharpening-stone down the length of his pickaxe!

triggers.name: overseer-greet
triggers.commands: stomp The overseer's face turns red with exertion. say This isn't the first thing that has gone missing!

triggers.name: overseer-missing
triggers.commands: fume say I know I left it in plain sight in the break room! say There must be a thief about! glare %actor.name%

triggers.name: overseer-receive
triggers.commands: if %object.vnum% == 13304 wait 1s blink say This is mine.  It was stolen. wait 1s mecho %self.name% inspects the pickaxe carefully. frown say It smells like lizard, so you couldn't have stolen it. wait 2s shrug say I am in your debt for returning it. mload obj 13305 bow %actor.name% wait 1s say Please accept these as a token of my gratitude. give goggles %actor.name% wait 1s wield overseer-pickaxe mecho %self.name% gets back to work. else frown say No, that's not what's gone missing. say Youngsters these days all have rocks for brains. endif

triggers.name: heavens_gate_starlight_greet
triggers.commands: set stage %actor.quest_stage[heavens_gate]% msend %actor% msend %actor% &7&bSoft starlight glitters throughout the cavern in welcome as you enter.&0 if %actor.class% /= Priest && %actor.level% > 80 if %stage% == 0 msend %actor% msend %actor% &7&bA strange light glints off a strange rock formation near the center of the cavern.&0 if %get.obj_count[13350]% == 0 mload obj 13350 endif elseif %stage% == 1 if %get.obj_count[13350]% == 0 mload obj 13350 endif msend %actor% &7&b%self.name% coalesces into the ephemeral shape of a bent old woman, standing before the rock formation.&0 msend %actor% &7&bSwirling stars form the shape of a bowl in her hands, which she puts on the rock pedestal.&0 msend %actor% msend %actor% &7&bThe crone invites you to &6&b[commune] &7&bfor visions of your progress.&0 elseif %stage% == 2 if %get.obj_count[13350]% == 0 mload obj 13350 endif msend %actor% &7&bThe floating apparition of a valiant young knight constructed from starbeams hovers over the pedestal.&0 msend %actor% &7&bHe seems to invite you to &6&b[put] &7&bsomething on the &7&b[pedestal]&7&b.&0 msend %actor% msend %actor% &7&bThe knight invites you to &6&b[commune] &7&bfor visions of your progress.&0 elseif %stage% == 3 msend %actor% &7&bA starry serpent slithers through the rocky cavern.&0 msend %actor% &7&bIt looks at you with expectant, curious eyes.&0 msend %actor% msend %actor% &7&bThe serpent invites you to &6&b[commune] &7&bfor visions of your progress or a new Key.&0 elseif %stage% == 4 wait 1s msend %actor% &7&bThe starlight manifests as the heavenly raven again.&0 wait 2s msend %actor% This time, at last, it speaks:&_ msend %actor% &6&b'I I I I am the book.  Open me prophet; read; decypher.&0 msend %actor% &6&bOn you, in you, in your blood, they write, have written.&0 msend %actor% &6&bSpeak it but aloud to know the path of heaven for I I I I am the final key.&0 msend %actor% &6&bI I I I have shown you visions, and through me you shall read.'&0 msend %actor% msend %actor% &3yamo lv soeeiy vrtvln eau okia khz lrrvzryp gvxrj bzjbie hi&0 endif endif

triggers.name: heavens_gate_starlight_look
triggers.commands: if %actor.class% /= Priest && %actor.level% > 80 && %actor.quest_stage[heavens_gate]% == 0 oechoaround %actor% %actor.name% stands completely still, staring intently at nothing. wait 1s osend %actor% &7&bYour mind is suddenly overwhelmed by the vision of a swirling vortex of stars above the formation.&0 osend %actor% &7&bIt opens a gateway through the heavens!&0 wait 4s osend %actor% &7&bSwirls of galaxies and flares of stars begin to meld within the vortex.&0 osend %actor% &7&bThey form a cosmic raven, which soars down to greet you.&0 wait 4s osend %actor% &7&bIn dance-like flight, it mimics a priest, bent over the rock pedestal in prayer.&0 osend %actor% &7&bThe starlight glistens in the shape of a bowl on the rock.&0 wait 4s osend %actor% &7&bThe raven finishes the dance and melds with the bowl.&0 osend %actor% &7&bYou find yourself gazing into a bowl with the symbol of a raven outlined in silver.&0 osend %actor% &7&bIts wings outstretched with feathers and talons marked with thin lines.&0 wait 4s osend %actor% &7&bThe bowl seems to promise ancient sacred knowledge if only it could be brought to this place!&0 wait 4s osend %actor% &7&bThe raven invites you to &6&b[commune] &7&bto receive visions of your progress.&0 wait 2s osend %actor% Returning to reality, you find yourself staring at the rock pedestal. quest start heavens_gate %actor.name% endif

triggers.name: heavens_gate_pedestal_put
triggers.commands: switch %target.vnum% case 23817 if %actor.quest_stage[heavens_gate]% == 1 wait 2 quest advance heavens_gate %actor.name% opurge bowl wait 2 oecho Starlight settles on the burnished silver of %get.obj_shortdesc[23817]%. wait 1s osend %actor.name% &7&bFor a moment, all is calm, until the starlight crone rushes at you!&0 wait 2s osend %actor% &7&bYou receive a vision of seven keys to seven gates &6&b[put] &7&bupon the &6&b[pedestal]&0. wait 1s osend %actor% &7&bOne by one you receive a vision of each key:&0&_ osend %actor% &6&b1. A small skeleton key forged of night and shadow&0 osend %actor% &0   hidden deep in a twisted labyrinth.&0&_ osend %actor% &6&b2. A key made from a piece of the black and pitted wood&0 osend %actor% &0   typical of trees in the Twisted Forest near Mielikki.&0&_ osend %actor% &6&b3. A large, black key humming with magical energy from&0 osend %actor% &0   a twisted cruel city in a huge underground cavern.&0&_ osend %actor% &6&b4. A key covered in oil&0 osend %actor% &0   kept by a long-dead caretaker in a necropolis.&0&_ osend %actor% &6&b5. A rusted but well cared for key&0 osend %actor% &0   carried by an enormous griffin.&0&_ osend %actor% &6&b6. A golden plated, wrought-iron key&0 osend %actor% &0   held at the gates to a desecrated city.&0&_ osend %actor% &6&b7. One nearly impossible to see&0 osend %actor% &0   guarded by a fiery beast with many heads.&0 wait 1s osend %actor% &7&bEach key transforms into a star forming a circle in the sky.&0 osend %actor% &7&bThey open some kind of gateway, leading into the unknown.&0 wait 1s osend %actor% &7&bThe starlight crone gestures to the pedestal before dissipating into the dark.&0 else set response default endif break case 4005 case 12142 case 23709 case 47009 case 49008 case 52012 case 52013 if %actor.quest_stage[heavens_gate]% == 2 if %actor.quest_variable[heavens_gate:%target.vnum%]% return 0 osend %actor% The star knight refuses to take a second copy of the key. halt else quest variable heavens_gate %actor.name% %target.vnum% 1 wait 1 opurge %self.contents% wait 2 set key1 %actor.quest_variable[heavens_gate:4005]% set key2 %actor.quest_variable[heavens_gate:12142]% set key3 %actor.quest_variable[heavens_gate:23709]% set key4 %actor.quest_variable[heavens_gate:47009]% set key5 %actor.quest_variable[heavens_gate:49008]% set key6 %actor.quest_variable[heavens_gate:52012]% set key7 %actor.quest_variable[heavens_gate:52013]% if (%key1% + %key2% + %key3% + %key4% + %key5% + %key6% + %key7%) == 7 quest advance heavens_gate %actor.name% wait 1s osend %actor% &7&bThe starry knight lifts the seven keys into the air.&0 wait 2s osend %actor% &7&bThe keys begin to glow and swirl around one another.&0 wait 2s osend %actor% &7&bThey fuse together into a single shining electrum key!&0 oload obj 13351 oforce %actor% get key wait 1s osend %actor% &7&bThe valiant star knight reveals to you seven anomalies that threaten Ethilien.&0 wait 1s osend %actor% &7&bYou see:&0 osend %actor% &0&6&b1. A pool in a temple of ice and stone&0 osend %actor% &0   leading to the realm of a death god.&0&_ osend %actor% &0&6&b2. A pool in a temple of ice and stone&0 osend %actor% &0   leading to the realm of a war god.&0&_ osend %actor% &0&6&b3. A pool hidden under a well&0 osend %actor% &0   on an island filled with ferocious beasts.&0&_ osend %actor% &0&6&b4. A portal from black rock&0 osend %actor% &0   to black ice.&0&_ osend %actor% &0&6&b5. A portal from a fortress of the undead&0 osend %actor% &0   to a realm of demons.&0&_ osend %actor% &0&6&b6. An archway that delivers demons&0 osend %actor% &0   to the fortress of the dead.&0&_ osend %actor% &0&6&b7. An arch hidden in another plane&0 osend %actor% &0   granting demons access to an enchanted village of mutants.&0 wait 1s osend %actor% &7&bUnintelligible words burble forth from the rifts... &0 wait 2s osend %actor% &7&bIn your soul you hear the call to take the Key of Heaven and &6&bseal &7&bthe &6&brifts!&0 opurge %self% else osend %actor% &7&bThe starlight twinkles in recognition of your deed!&0&_ &_ osend %actor% &7&bIt places the key in the bowl and beckons you to bring another.&0 endif endif else set response default endif break default set response default done if %response% == default osend %actor% Nothing happens. endif

triggers.name: heavens_gate_key_seal
triggers.commands: if %arg% /= rift || %arg% /= portal || %arg% /= pool || %arg% /= arch set seal %actor.quest_variable[heavens_gate:sealed]% if %self.room% == 51077 || %self.room% == 16407 || %self.room% == 16094 || %self.room% == 55735 || %self.room% == 49024 || %self.room% == 55126 || %self.room% == 55112 if %actor.quest_variable[heavens_gate:%self.room%]% osend %actor% You have already sealed this anomaly. else if %actor.quest_stage[heavens_gate]% == 3 quest variable heavens_gate %actor.name% %self.room% 1 osend %actor% You begin to chant... oechoaround %actor% %actor.name% begins to chant... osend %actor% The power of the heavens courses through %self.shortdesc%. wait 2s oecho %self.shortdesc% begins to burn with a fierce energy! wait 2s oecho Brilliant rays of light shoot out of %self.shortdesc%, sealing the dimensional portal! if %self.room% == 51077 opurge arch oteleport all 51003 elseif %self.room% == 16407 opurge arch elseif %self.room% == 49024 || %self.room% == 55126 || %self.room% == 55112 opurge energy elseif %self.room% == 16094 || %self.room% == 55735 opurge portal endif eval sealed %seal% + 1 quest variable heavens_gate %actor.name% sealed %sealed% wait 1s switch %sealed% case 1 osend %actor% As the rift collapses, words float up in your mind: osend %actor% &7&byamo lv&0 break case 2 osend %actor% As the rift collapses, words float up in your mind: osend %actor% &7&byamo lv soeeiy&0 break case 3 osend %actor% As the rift collapses, words float up in your mind: osend %actor% &7&byamo lv soeeiy vrtvln&0 break case 4 osend %actor% As the rift collapses, words float up in your mind: osend %actor% &7&byamo lv soeeiy vrtvln eau okia khz&0 break case 5 osend %actor% As the rift collapses, words float up in your mind: osend %actor% &7&byamo lv soeeiy vrtvln eau okia khz lrrvzryp&0 break case 6 osend %actor% As the rift collapses, words float up in your mind: osend %actor% &7&byamo lv soeeiy vrtvln eau okia khz lrrvzryp gvxrj&0 break case 7 osend %actor% As the rift collapses, words float up in your mind: osend %actor% &7&byamo lv soeeiy vrtvln eau okia khz lrrvzryp gvxrj bzjbie hi&0 wait 2s set room %get.room[13358]% osend %actor% &7&bA vision of starlight beckons you back to %room.name%.&0 quest advance heavens_gate %actor.name% break default return 0 done endif endif else osend %actor% There are no active rifts here to seal. endif else return 0 endif

triggers.name: heavens_gate_starlight_speech1
triggers.argument_list: Hark ye starry angels and open the heavenly gates before me
triggers.commands: if %actor.quest_stage[heavens_gate] == 4 wait 1s mecho &7&bStarlight spreads wide across the cavern.&0 mecho &6A &btunnel of &7light &6opens up!&0 wait 3s msend %actor% &7&bFrom the reaches of the heavens some unknowable entity touches your soul.&0 msend %actor% &7&bIt imparts a prayer to you.&0 msend %actor% mskillset %actor.name% heavens gate quest complete heavens_gate %actor.name% msend %actor% &6&bYou have learned &7Heavens Gate&6!&0 wait 2s mecho &7&bThe starlight pours into the &6&btunnel &7&band is gone!&0 mpurge %self% endif

triggers.name: heavens_gate_starlight_status_checker
triggers.commands: switch %cmd% case c case co case com case comm return 0 halt done set stage %actor.quest_stage[heavens_gate]% if %stage% > 0 || %actor.has_completed[heavens_gate]% msend %actor% You %actor% &6&bA small skeleton key forged of night and shadow&0 msend %actor% &0hidden deep in a twisted labyrinth.&0 msend %actor% endif if !%key2% msend %actor% &6&bA key made from a piece of the fortress set room %get.room[16094]% msend %actor% %room.name% endif if %seal4% * Black rock trail set room %get.room[55735]% msend %actor% %room.name% endif if %seal5% * Griffin set room %get.room[49024]% msend %actor% %room.name% endif if %seal6% * Huitzipia - war set room %get.room[55126]% msend %actor% %room.name% endif if %seal7% * Xapizo - death set room %get.room[55112]% msend phrase yamo lv soeeiy vrtvln eau okia khz lrrvzryp gvxrj bzjbie break default return 0 halt done if %sealed% msend %actor% msend %actor% Words float up in your mind: &6&b%phrase%&0 endif mecho msend %actor% If you need a new Key, beseech the starlight, &6&b"Grant me a new key"&0. elseif %stage% == 4 msend %actor% The starlight manifests as the heavenly raven again. msend %actor% This time, at last, it speaks:&_ msend %actor% &6&b'I I I I am the book.  Open me prophet; read; decypher.&0 msend %actor% &6&bOn you, in you, in your blood, they write, have written.&0 msend %actor% &6&bSpeak it but aloud to know the path of heaven for I I I I am the final key.&0 msend %actor% &6&bI I I I have shown you visions, and through me you shall read.'&0&_ msend %actor% &3yamo lv soeeiy vrtvln eau okia khz lrrvzryp gvxrj bzjbie hi&0 elseif %actor.has_completed[heavens_gate]% msend %actor% &6&bYou feel you have learned all you can from this place.&0 endif else return 0 endif

triggers.name: **UNUSED**
triggers.commands: return 0

triggers.name: heavens_gate_key_replacement
triggers.commands: if %actor.quest_stage[heavens_gate]% == 3 wait 2 if %actor.inventory[13351]% msend %actor% &6&bYou already possess a Key of Heaven.&0 else mecho &7&bThe stars coalesce into a shining key!&0 mload obj 13351 give key-heaven %actor% endif endif

rooms.name: Entrance to a Mine
rooms.description: Dug into the sides of a solid-looking foothill, this tunnel surprisingly hits solid rock very fast.  The cavern's mouth is very wide and has the unmistakable marks of dwarven craftmanship everywhere.  A packed-down stairway with shallow steps leads back up to the Eldorian Foothills and a small tunnel leads north into a well-lit shaft humming slightly with the sound of distant activity.

rooms.name: Miner's Cavern Intersection
rooms.description: Torches placed at regular intervals light the mine with a strong, if somewhat smoky, illumination.  The walls are made of a black rock with beautiful bands of intrusive crystals that sparkle in the firelight.  In some places, it looks like the walls have been chipped at to get to a particularly eye-catching crystal specimen.  Tunnels branch off in all directions here, though to the south is a fresh breeze indicating the mine's exit.

rooms.name: West Shaft
rooms.description: Smoky torches light this tunnel, showing strong support beams and glinting stone in the walls of the shaft.  However, rather than any precious gems, it seems that the glinting is only quartz and mica - pretty in the light, but worthless.  A small pile of handcarved toys sits in one corner.  The mine shaft continues west and the shaft intersection is to the east.

rooms.name: West Shaft
rooms.description: The mine shaft continues east and west here, following what was once a vein of some metal or mineral and is now probably fine dwarven craftmanship in the hands of people all over Caelia.  Though it looks like this shaft is no longer actively being mined, it still sees some traffic by dwarves inspecting the walls for secondary veins or particularly fine specimens of the quartz crystals that seem to be everywhere, glinting in the torchlight.

rooms.name: West Shaft
rooms.description: Strong torchlight illuminates solid-looking oak support beams throughout the mine tunnel, which leads east and west from here.  The walls are composed of a mix of basalt and granite sprinkled with many different mineral veins as well as the shiny glint of quartz and mica and, occasionally, black obsidian inclusions.  Though it is not as heavily trafficked as other sections of the mine, the western shaft is still decently populated.

rooms.name: West Shaft
rooms.description: Small boulders scattered on the floor of the mine make footing treacherous here, though tracks in the dirt indicate that there were recently even more rocks along the sides of the tunnel.  Perhaps this area is actively being cleared.  The tunnel continues east and west.

rooms.name: West Shaft
rooms.description: The mine continues east and west here, lit everywhere by bright torchlight. Judging by the soot on the sides of the tunnel, this part of the mine has been in operation for quite a while.  Stones of many colors line the walls, but it seems like the dwarves ignore anything that isn't obviously valuable.  It does put the lie to the stereotypical uniform grey color of rocks, though.

rooms.name: A Bend in the West Shaft
rooms.description: The mine shaft bends north and east here, probably following the vein of whatever it was that was originally mined here.  The distant hum and clink of mining activity can be heard from afar, but this shaft seems pretty quiet.  It probably isn't being actively mined anymore.

rooms.name: West Shaft
rooms.description: The air seems fresher in this part of the mine owing to a light breeze. The torches are less smoky as well, so there must be some ventilation shaft around here somewhere.  The shaft curves south and west, probably following the natural vein of metal or gems that was originally mined here.

rooms.name: West Shaft
rooms.description: This section of the western shaft looks much like any other part of the mine.  Torchlit stones glimmer in the cool air whilst rubble on the floor makes it a little unsafe to walk around without paying attention to one's surroundings.  The mine shaft continues east and west.

rooms.name: West Shaft
rooms.description: Only torchlight illuminates the long tunnels of the mine.  All that stands between the mine and untold tons of rock above are steady oak beams that still look strong despite their age, though from time to time a bit of dust falls down from above.  This, along with the smoke of the torches, makes it a little difficult to see very far.  The shaft continues east and west.

rooms.name: West Shaft
rooms.description: The air is still in this part of the mine, and it seems to be heavy with humidity as well.  Some of the granite on the walls is covered with lichens in various colors ranging from black to green to orange.  It does not seem like this part of the mine is being actively worked on, judging by the lichen growth.  The shaft continues east and west.

rooms.name: A Bend in the West Shaft
rooms.description: The mine shaft bends north and east here, and there is definately a cool hunidity present in the air.  There is a slight breeze that flows in from the north, and the sounds of mining activity are so faint that the cavern is almost encased in silence.  The strongest sound is that of the crackling torches that light the shaft.

rooms.name: A Dead End in the West Shaft
rooms.description: The shaft looks as though it is supposed to continue north here, but it dead-ends in a pool of water.  Small fungi grow here, but not many; it is probable, judging by the slow current in the pool, that the dwarves hit an underground spring that made it quite impossible to continue in this direction. The only exit is to the south.

rooms.name: Northern Shaft
rooms.description: Boulders and small rocks cover this section of the shaft.  Some are stacked and ready to be hauled away by the miners, but some are simply jumbled together, making it rather difficult to inspect the walls of the shaft closely. The sound of activity echoes up and down this shaft, indicating that it is probably still being mined.  The intersection of tunnels is to the south and the shaft continues north.

rooms.name: A Bend in the Northern Shaft
rooms.description: Dust in the air from pulverized rocks shows that this shaft of the mines is probably still active.  Large rocks litter the floor, ready to be carted off by young workers.  The sides of the shaft are covered in alternating streaks of black and pink veins of minerals, but it seems the dwarves were uninterested in mining them.  The shaft continues to the south and bends to the east.

rooms.name: A Bend in the Northern Shaft
rooms.description: The mine takes another turn here, leading north and west.  Bright torchlight shows walls studded with feldspar, quartz, and other minerals.  Occasionally there is an odd-looking hole in the walls of the shaft.  The sounds of activity come from all directions.

extras.text: It looks like this is a place where the dwarves saw a small mineral inclusion they wanted and mined it out of the sides of the walls.

rooms.name: The Northern Shaft
rooms.description: The mine shaft slopes downward to the north at a gentle angle, following the vein of metal or mineral that the dwarves are seeking.  A few stone benches line the walls here underneath the smoky, yet bright, torches.  The clinking sounds of metal on rock are strong, suggesting this section of the mines is still active.

extras.text: There are a few stone benches along the walls here, set up in case some dwarves need to take a short break.

rooms.name: The Northern Shaft
rooms.description: This mine shaft still looks rather rough, with chunks of rock sticking out in many directions and lacking the polished look of a finished dwarven creation.  Dark veins run along the tunnel's walls parallel to the shaft, giving the impression of being inside a large, striped mouth.  It is possible to proceed north or south.

rooms.name: The Northern Shaft
rooms.description: Yellowish torchlight shows more and more of the seemingly endless mine shaft, which leads north and south here.  Rough chunks of ore and what appears to be normal stone are scattered about the tunnel, impeding progress a little. The glittering mica and quartz of the walls gives this part of the mines a magical appearance, but it is only rock, after all.

rooms.name: The Northern Shaft
rooms.description: The mine descends a bit to the north, though south will lead back to the main tunnels and, far away, the entrance.  Torches seem a little smokier than usual in this room and it does not seem to be particularly well ventilated. The walls of the shaft are once again covered in veins of minerals stretching down the passageway.

rooms.name: A Bend in the Northern Shaft
rooms.description: This section of the mines is lower in elevation than the tunnel to the south, and for once the floor is clear of ore and rubble.  The shaft bends off to the east, following the natural curve of the iron vein mined in this section.  Loud clinking noises echo around, making it slightly difficult to tell where they are coming from.

rooms.name: The Northern Shaft
rooms.description: Though the floor is littered with chunks of ore, it is still fairly easy to move around in here.  The steel dwarven boots have crunched over rock for so long that this room is thick with a heavy rock dust, coloring everything grey that sits here for more than a moment.  The shaft continues east and west.

rooms.name: The Northern Shaft
rooms.description: Deep underneath the mountains of Eldoria, the thick oak support beams are all that prevent the weight of the earth from crashing down on this narrow tunnel.  Good thing the dwarven craftsmen are wise enough to use one of the strongest known woods in their mines.  The shaft goes east and west, following a vein of iron.

rooms.name: The Northern Shaft
rooms.description: A vein of pure white quartz runs along the northern wall of this section of the mines, running for nearly three feet before it disappears into the main tunnel section.  It looks like it intersected the iron vein for a while, though no sign of it can be seen on the other side.  The shaft runs east-west.

rooms.name: An Intersection in the Mines
rooms.description: This rather open section of the mines is where the east-west running vein and the north-south running vein seem to have met each other.  The northeast corner of the intersection is, indeed, rich with iron ore in amazing quantities.  The tunnels lead back to the west and south, though it looks like the dwarves are still solidifying the connection between the two shafts - the southern shaft is about a foot higher than the eastern, so it would be prudent to watch your step!

rooms.name: The Black Shaft
rooms.description: The shaft seems to brighten up as it heads north, with occasional rocks of lighter color intruding on the dark veins that have the rest of the shaft in their grip.  Running north-south to follow an iron vein, the shaft is quite wide here; however, it was definately made for dwarves.  Taller races might bump their heads on the low ceiling.

rooms.name: The Black Shaft
rooms.description: Though the torches burn valiantly against the dark, the black walls of the shaft seem to absorb the firelight, and the rough walls invite shadows to dance around them.  Fortunately the sounds of miners at work keeps this section of the tunnels from being terribly frightening.  The black shaft continues north and south.

extras.text: The shadows in this room barely conceal a rough emblem chiselled into the western wall: an inverted triangle surrounded by three spheres.  Someone apparently put it here as homage to the goddess Kourrya.

rooms.name: The Black Shaft
rooms.description: Following a rich vein of iron, this mine shaft continues north and south. None of the lighter-colored minerals of the earlier section of the mines can be seen here.  An alcove has been drilled into the eastern wall, looking eerily like a wound in the rock.

extras.text: Upon closer inspection, the sides of the drilled alcove look to be made of kimberlite.  There were diamonds here once.

rooms.name: The Black Shaft
rooms.description: Sturdy oak support beams prevent the mine from collapsing, lending the strength of the druids' most beloved wood to a work they are well suited for. A faint humming sound can be heard underneath the clinking sounds echoing back and forth from the north and south, though it is difficult to tell what it means.

West.description: The faint outline of a door can be seen in the wall to the west.

rooms.name: The Dark Shaft
rooms.description: In this dark section of the mine, it finally becomes clear what the dwarves are mining here: Iron!  Ore of this base metal glints out from the dark walls of the mine shaft, simply waiting to be extracted by the expert hands of the miners.  The shaft continues both north and south.

rooms.name: The Dark Shaft
rooms.description: Dark stones line the walls in all directions, from the shiny, nearly metallic hematite to the dark basalt that speaks of the volcanic origins of the rock.  Heavy tracks of minecarts and dwarven bootprints criscross one another so often that individual tracks cannot be made out.  The shaft continues north and south.

rooms.name: A Bend in the East Shaft
rooms.description: Sturdy pillars of oak support the weight of the earth in this bend of the shaft, which leads north and west.  The western end looks very large, though bright torchlight comes form both directions.  Crystallized minerals reflect the torchlight back beautifully from the veins embedded in the stone.  Though it is cool in the mines, the dwarven workers probably work hard enough to keep more than warm enough - and visiting adventurers should keep this in mind as well.

rooms.name: East Shaft
rooms.description: Still massive, though not as large as the natural cavern to the east, this tunnel runs east-west.  A slight breeze carries cool air around the mine, coming from the east.  The rocks are mostly dark here, though strains of a pink mineral are abundant as well.  The dirt of the floor is stamped down with years and years of continual labor and the passageway is kept clear.  This part of the mine likely sees heavy traffic.

rooms.name: A Rest Area
rooms.description: This is a suddenly broad area in the mines.  It looks like the dwarves hit a natural cavern with their tunneling, and have turned it into a rest area for the mine workers.  Stalactites and stalagmites, though small, appear here and nowhere else in the mine complex.  Benches are arranged into squares for the miners to rest on or eat dinner around and stacks of crates with supplies are arranged nicely on the walls of the cavern.  A large, bright fire lights up the room, while comparatively small and dark mine shafts lead to the east and west. It seems like a good place to take a break.

rooms.name: East Shaft
rooms.description: The tunnel widens a bit here, evenly spaced torches highlighting beautiful quartz crystals embedded in the granite walls.  The miners seem to have been tunneling after a specific vein of some metal or mineral, but it is difficult to say what it was.  The mine continues east and west.

rooms.name: The Begining of the East Shaft
rooms.description: A massive tunnel chipped out of the earth leads off from the intersection to the east.  Rugged wooden pillars support the mine in places to ensure the safety of those working inside the mine.  The temperature in the mine is cool despite the proximity to the fiery torches and the close, almost cramped tunnel walls.  The shaft continues east and west.

rooms.name: An unfinished room
rooms.description: You are in an unfinished room.

rooms.name: An unfinished room
rooms.description: You are in an unfinished room.

rooms.name: The Broken Elevator
rooms.description: A spacious room has been cut into the surrounding stone, made to house a simple elavator constructed of stone and oak with iron chain pulleys. Unfortunately, the iron chains have gone to rust and one of the pulleys is broken.  This seems a bit out of place - everywhere else in the mine, dwarven tools are cared for rigorously and never allowed to remain broken for long. It looks possible to continue downwards by a narrow stone stair, though mine carts or other heavy objects could not be brought down unless the elevator were to be fixed.

East.description: A door has been cut into the stone of the eastern wall.

rooms.name: Below the Broken Elevator
rooms.description: Two empty torch brackets speak of a time when this area of the mine was well cared-for, but broken tools covered in dust that litter the floor suggest that this place has not seen active work in some time.  Indeed, closer inspection of the floor reveals mine cart tracks underneath bootprints and other disturbances of the dirt.  In fact, some of the tracks don't look humanoid at all.  A narrow stone stair leads up to the top of the elevator shaft, and the tunnel continues to the south.

rooms.name: The Limestone Shaft
rooms.description: Leading north and south, sloping downwards to the south, this section of the mines seems copletely diferent from the hard granite and basalt layers above, as the walls are made of a soft, easy-to-work limestone.  Also unlike the upper mine shafts, this tunnel lacks the stunning crystalline structures and rich mineral veins.  The shaft is also wider, though this could just be due to the relative ease of working limestone.

rooms.name: The Limestone Shaft
rooms.description: Sloping downwards to the south and up to the north, this tunnel is made of soft limestone.  Unusual in the extreme, for veins of precious metal tend not to exist in this softer stone, the shaft seems nevertheless quite like a dwarven-made structure and unlike a natural tunnel.  Rough edges and oak supports line the walls, though the supports could probably use some updating. Lichens and fungi, pale-colored, grow near the bottom of the shaft.

rooms.name: The Limestone Shaft
rooms.description: The temperature in these limestone tunnels is definitely getting cooler as they descend into the depths of the earth.  South is deeper into this unusual section of the mine, and north leads back up to the broken elevator shaft and, ultimately, the active section of the mines.  A strange, high-pitched squeaking echoes all around the mineshaft, and tiny cave bugs are constantly underfoot. Signs of non-animal life are rare, but can be seen here and there - a broken hammer, a bootprint overgrown with fungus, and more.

rooms.name: A Bend in the Limestone Shaft
rooms.description: The tunnel bends to the north and west here.  Along the southeastern wall is a deposit of strange, blocky crystals that seem somehow familiar.  No fungus grows on that wall, but the inhabitants of the cave don't seem to mind its presence, some of the larger ones even going out of their way to...  Lick the crystals?

extras.text: Upon closer inspection, it appears this is a deposit of rock salt!

rooms.name: Buried Skeleton of a Great Monster
rooms.description: Magnificently laid bare against the pale stone of the tunnel is the skeleton of a long-dead creature, bones turned to stone over the ages.  Whatever it was, it had four limbs, a pointy snout, and was extremely large.  The shaft itself has been widened into something of a cavern to allow the entire skeleton to be observed at once.  It is a humbling reminder that even the greatest and most powerful creatures can be defeated, if only by time itself.  The tunnel leads east and west from here.

rooms.name: The Limestone Shaft
rooms.description: The floor slopes sharply here, leading down to the west and up to the east. The walls seem rather featureless, except for the tiny lichens and fungi that cling to their existance with everything they have, though there are very few nutrients here and even less water.  Still, there seems to be enough to support a tiny system of bugs and other resilient critters.

rooms.name: The Limestone Shaft
rooms.description: The influence of the dwarves is pretty minimal in this tunnel.  It is shored up with supports and obviously bears the marks of picks and other tools, but there are no torch brackets, old tools, or even footprints.  Instead there is a relative abundance of cave life that has claimed the tunnel as their own.  Why was this tunnel made, if only to be abandoned?  The shaft continues east and west.

rooms.name: A Turn in the Limestone Shaft
rooms.description: There is a sudden bend here, and stairs lead down in the northerly direction from a landing that connects to the main tunnel east.  The stairs seem, suddenly, very unnatural when compared to the rest of the mineshaft.  Surely mine carts wouldn't be able to make it down there, which again asks the question of what the dwarves wanted down in this mineral-poor limestone bed. It must have been something, surely...

rooms.name: The Limestone Shaft
rooms.description: Deep inside the dark earth, the air is cold and still yet smells fresh. Here and there tiny patches of fungus grow out of the sides of the shaft, and there are tiny shells embedded in the limestone.  How did they get here, so far from the sea?  It could just be some dwarven trick; they are considered masters of stone with good reason.  The tunnel continues to the north and south, sloping downwards to the south.

rooms.name: The Limestone Shaft
rooms.description: Nearly level here, the mine shaft is shored up with more oak supports than elsewhere, suggesting the tiniest bit of instability in this part of the tunnel.  Hopefully the dwarves knew what they were doing.  It seems so, for despite many pebbles on the floor there are no threatening creaks or fissures. Still, it might be wise to leave north or south.

rooms.name: A Bend in the Limestone Shaft
rooms.description: A bend in the limestone shaft leads east and south, with the eastern end descending yet further into the earth.  Clicking noises are coming from somewhere nearby, but cannot be placed precisely.  The limestone down here is so finely grained that it could probably be written with like chalk, though it does not seem quite as brittle as chalk.  Lichens don't seem to care, and grow on it without worrying about superficial things like whether or not someone could use their home as a writing material.

rooms.name: The Limestone Shaft
rooms.description: What would otherwise be a hardly noticeable trickle of water has smoothed down the southern wall of the shaft to such an extent that it reflects back all light, almost like a mirror.  Fungi and lichens are particularly abundant here, no doubt due to the water, but there is so little water that a thirsty adventurer would hardly be able to get a bare mouthful.  The shaft continues east and west.

rooms.name: A Bend in the Limestone Shaft
rooms.description: The shaft turns once again here, leading south and west.  The western route slopes upwards and out of the mine, though by now it would be quite a journey back to the surface.  The lumber supports seem old, but not yet in need of repair - the dwarves built to last, even though they have to all appearances abandoned this deep shaft.

rooms.name: Dead End
rooms.description: Here, the limestone tunnel seems to have broken into a natural cavern below. There is a fairly sizeable hole leading down into an open, dark space.  Oddly, the dwarves have apparently not modified the hole much from its original roughness, leaving it with an unfinished look that doesn't fit at all with the rest of the mine shaft.  North back up the limestone shaft or down into darkness are the only two options.

rooms.name: The Heart of the Mine
rooms.description: Here, the dwarven miners have broken into a spacious natural cavern. Breathtakingly beautiful crystal formations are everywhere, as though the cavern itself were the inside of a geode.  Oddly, the crystals have not been mined, though many show signs of pick and chisel nearby.  It almost looks like the dwarves were removing baser rocks in order to bring forth the natural beauty of the crystals rather than extracting them to sell for profit. Massive stalactites and stalagmites are spaced nearly evenly around the room, and natural passages lead off to the north, west, and south.  The dwarven-made tunnel leaves up.

East.description: The air coming from this direction is rather chilly.  Is that a door concealed in the rock?

extras.text: There is one due north, and then othersto the northeast, northwest, southeast, and southwest.  If one were to connect them in the right way, they would form a pentagram.

rooms.name: The Heart of the Mine South
rooms.description: It is very hot in here, though the reason is immediately apparent: there is a river of molten lava directly to the south!  Though the tunnels continue on past the lava, it would be quite impossible to reach them without burning oneself to a crisp.  Along the eastern wall are what seem to be implements of a forge.  This place was probably used by the dwarves in construction of some of their finest artifacts, though it is now abandoned.  A cool breeze comes in from the north, which is the only sensible exit.

South.description: Bubbling hot lava blocks the way south.

rooms.name: The Heart of the Mine East
rooms.description: Amazingly, the eastern heart of the mine is home to a narrow chimney that reaches all the way out of the bedrock and up to the foothills above.  Chill air rushes down from above, giving some freshness to the otherwise stale cavern air.  The chimney is barely straight and wide enough to allow light from the outside world down here, whether it be starlight or the sun.  It is, however, too small for even a gnome to use as an exit.

West.description: There is a door here concealed in the stone.

extras.text: These runes give off a picture of a hungry person giving a wonderfull reward for helping him.

rooms.name: The Heart of the Mine North
rooms.description: In the north heart of the mine, a foul smell pervades the air.  Bones of tiny creatures crunch underfoot, many of them savagely ripped into splinters. A few larger bones have visible toothmarks but remain whole.  A nest of torn cloth and fur in one corner marks this as the lair of some kind of beast.  The heart of the mine is to the south.

rooms.name: The Heart of the Mine West
rooms.description: Water drops down slowly from a magnificent waterfall frozen in stone.  It catches in a basin of dwarven manufacture set about waist-high.  The basin has tiny upwards-growing stalagmites where the water falls, suggesting it's been here for quite some time.  The excess water falls to the floor and drains away in a tunnel leading west that is far too small to allow passage.  The heart of the mine lies to the west.

extras.text: The sign in the room reads.  Make your self at home drink and fill your canteens if needed.
